name: When driving post, use a driving cap with timber or plastic insert to avoid damage to the post
Height to centre of rail is 635mm
Top of post should be a minimum of 20mm above top of guardrail
Post is aligned with flanges rail for road side applications and alignment is alternating for median applications
There is a 90mm dia. Washer between rail and post.
Rail is lapped in the direction of traffic
Nut on backside of post is a splice nut
If a median installation-excessive bolt length is cut off on backside
That transition details to existing guardrail or terminations are correct
The above works have been inspected and are considered compliant with the drawings, specifications and instructions
Panels are pre-bent to suite curves.
The rail height is in accordance with the plans and specification.
Correct lapping of rail away from the direction of Traffic.
Timber block outs secured to the post.
Posts align, at correct spacing and backfilled compacted.
Post bolts are tight and washer is fitted at the back of post.
Backing pieces are fitted at the intermediate post only.
With flange based post the necked bolts are installed with washer.
The above works have been inspected and are considered compliant with the drawings, specifications and instructions
